Review.Titre: Nexcess (liquidweb) is a scam company, stay away
Review.Contenu: This is a scam company. I wanted to try this service on Saturday, and their chat support told me to pay the invoice before I can use their wordpress hosting service. I paid the invoice on Saturday, and suddenly they told me they couldn't activate my hosting plan because their billing team was away until Monday. This logic doesn't even make sense, if their billing team was the only one who could activate the hosting, why did they suggest me to pay the invoice? Why they didn't tell me to wait until Monday? This is a fraud company

This has most likely been the worst experience of migrating to a new hosting service. In particular, the support has been poor. Constantly chasing support tickets. Slow replies - 7 hours sometimes.Chat engineers are limited in their abilities to investigate technical issues and the opening support tickets. Then support ticket staff replying to the same problem with different responses contradicting the other.The company has too many different people working in support. It needs to be streamlined and get staff on board who have the skills they advertise - WordPress etc.Also, escalation to their 'onboarding manager' and other senior staff resulted in one email reply from one person. No one else in the thread. Nothing after that.Most of the solutions were then actually done by our own staff in-house.If you have a large website, compay reputation depending on it - do not use this host. Look at someone who really does care about new customers amd providing support that you expect.

will have a review about the lousy service nexcess gives. too many errors happen and there is no system to check. no notifications or anything like that. the client has to manually check the server's performance? too bad for a service and the money spent to rent it.I have never used a management service that is so unprofessional and unsafe. error always occursTicket #11698312

Review.Titre: Since Nexcess took over Futurehosting things are BAD
Review.Contenu: Since Nexcess took over Futurehosting, their customer service has become worse and worse and worse. They've gone from like 3 minute response time to sometimes up to 12 hours (guess why, outsourcing to Asia...). They have messed up my website, they cannot provide the services they used to - and they are by NO means WP experts any more. Very sad.

They claimed they were "conducting a disk restore on the hypervisor," which did not work. This is extremely poor service.

It's really simple for me.  FutureHosting was a company acquired by Nexcess.  FutureHosting had no phone support at all.  They only used a ticket system and they promptly replied to tickets. It saved a great deal of time for both FutureHosting and its customers, and provided a convenient record of the progress toward solutions.Today, I submit tickets to Nexcess that seem to confuse the support staff for a day, until they ultimately determine that I was a FutureHosting customer, and then they have to re-type my messages into the old FutureHosting system.It would make a great deal of sense to just allow me a way to post tickets directly to the FutureHosting support staff.  I always provide all the necessary details and access accounts, URLs & passwords so that they can navigate my systems.  I should be able to bypass the confusion & delay the current ticket system adds to FutureHosting customers.

I have a Managed WooCommerce hosting Starter plan with Nexcess but use a domain registered elsewhere. I needed to set up an autoresponder email because I was going on vacation and something as simple as that has become a nightmare. Firstly, Nexcess platform does not allow setting up an autoresponder from my main domain, instead the response email is sent from the default Nexcess hosting domain; this means our customers will email "@mydomain.pt" and get a response from "@XXXXX.nxcli.net" which is completely unprofessional in my opinion. We contacted Nexcess support, and a collaborator said that they could change the settings themselves to have the autoresponder come from our main domain. When the time came to activate the autoresponder, the email was still coming from the wrong email address and while we were already on vacation Nexcess support said they couldn't do a thing about it. One week later of having the autoresponder coming from the wrong email address, we came back and asked to turn off the autoresponder; two days have passed and it is still active; we cannot turn it off because this was set by the support team. Overall this was a terrible experience, I wouldn't recommend using Nexcess email service, and the customer support was totally unhelpful in this case, in fact they made it worst.

Review.Titre: Stay Away from Nexcess Hosting: Unreliable Services, Inadequate Technical Support, and Slow Response Time
Review.Contenu: I had a terrible experience with Nexcess hosting. Their services were far from satisfactory, and I cannot recommend them to anyone. The response time to my tickets was extremely slow, and I would sometimes have to wait up to 2-4 days for a reply.Furthermore, my website would crash whenever there were more than 800 or more concurrent users, even though I had the most expensive plan they offer. This was unacceptable, and their technical staff could not fix the issue. They promised me multiple times that they had resolved the issue, but it kept happening repeatedly.During a livestream event with paid members, my website was down for more than a day, which is totally unacceptable. Their services are not reliable!After switching to Hostinger recently, I had no issues with my website, and it could handle up to 5000+ concurrent users without any problem. It's clear that Nexcess hosting does not have the capacity or technical expertise to handle high-traffic websites.I should also mention that I had a similar experience with Futurehosting, which ran the service before Nexcess took over. At least with Futurehosting, the support team answered queries quickly, but the site still crashed in same way like with Nexcess. They do not have the capacity or technical staff to fix anything or help out when needed.I advise everyone to stay away from Nexcess hosting. Their services are unreliable, their technical support is inadequate, and their pricing is not worth the hassle. Choose other hosting services that can provide better support and handle high-traffic websites.

Review.Titre: Nexcess is one of my biggest business regrets
Review.Contenu: I signed up with Nexcess due to the glowing recommendations from my network and sites like Trust Pilot. I was moving over 30 sites away from WP Engine due to costs associated with that many sites on a single server. I wish I'd chosen a different company.Things already seemed a bit off during the migration process. The initial copying of my sites over to Nexcess caused a multitude of different and seemingly random issues on all but two of my sites - content switched to lorem ipsum, functionality disappearing despite the plugin behind it still being enabled, posts set to the wrong author, just all kinds of strange stuff that shouldn't happen with a routine migration. It took me over 10 hours to identify all of the issues across my sites to request they be fixed. When it came time to actually migrate the sites, two of the migration staff I worked with were lovely, but the other one was really frustrating. He didn't communicate with me for three hours after my migration was scheduled to start, and then when I reached out to cancel the migration that night since it was already so late, he began putting all of my sites in maintenance mode and even taking some of them offline without responding to me. Things didn't improve once I was up and running on Nexcess. My sites kept experiencing short downtimes, but support would gaslight me whenever I reached out to find out what had happened. "I don't see anything in the server logs, must have just been your internet." Right, that's why two separate uptime monitoring services both reported the site down...One of my sites that had been using PHP 7.4 for over a year on WP Engine began having spontaneous intermittent downtime one day. Support attributed it to a PHP 7.4 issue and told me I must have changed the PHP version and broke it (I didn't?). The site began to work again a few hours later, and Nexcess was never able to explain to me what happened to cause the issue. They said they saw nothing in the logs. It's still a mystery what took my eCommerce site offline in the middle of a business day.Pushing staging sites to production with Nexcess is, unfortunately, also a deeply frustrating experience. Unlike other hosts, there's no way to click a couple of buttons and push from one environment to another. You have to use WP Merge or Blogvault. WP Merge is powerful and a nice perk, but it's extremely complex to use and it's really easy to muck up your database with it. Blogvault is really easy, but takes much longer to copy a site from staging to production, and the site is down the entire time when doing so. At one point, Blogvault was giving me an error when trying to copy from staging to production. I reached out to support for help, but they couldn't figure it out. They suggested I try WP Merge, which overwrote all of the staging changes (despite supposedly copying from staging to production, not the other way around), forcing me to restore a day-old backup and re-do several hours worth of work. With both options not working, Nexcess had no solution for pushing my site to production to meet its launch schedule. Fortunately, the staff at Blogvault were very helpful and gave me a free trial to attempt migrating without using Nexcess as a middle-man, which worked perfectly. 22 hours later, someone at Nexcess support finally figured out what was wrong with Blogvault. I needed to include https:// in "destination site url" field, but not the "host/server address" field, or it wouldn't work. 22 hours and a late launch just because of their finicky setup (regular Blogvault worked perfectly whether https:// was included or not).The straw that finally broke the camel's back - and mind you, I only joined 3 months ago - was a huge outage last week. All of my sites were offline for over 2 hours sporadically throughout the day. Nexcess's status page was not informative about the status or reason behind the outage, and their support staff, as usual, couldn't tell me anything. Over a week later, the issue behind the outage hasn't been resolved and we experienced another, albeit shorter, outage yesterday that again took all of my sites offline multiple times. When the outage recurred yesterday and I first reached out to Nexcess to see if it was the same issue, they again began by blaming it on my personal internet before admitting there was another outage. I asked for information about the outage so I could explain to my clients what happened and what was being done to prevent it, and they closed my ticket without responding.I'm finally taking the time to migrate all of my sites away from Nexcess only 3 months after joining, and I'm counting the hours until I never have to deal with this platform again.

Used to be amazing, personal, extremely competent service; now support tickets take half a day or more for a response and usually come back as "looks like the site is up now?" after the issue has resolved itself. Imagine the most amazing piece of art you've ever beheld, and then imagine it set on fire, dragged backwards through mud for 1,000 miles (still on fire) and then finally extinguished by your tears, and you won't begin to come close to the experience of watching Nexcess degrade since acquisition.

Review.Titre: Indeed a helper of Fake DMCA Abuse!!
Review.Contenu: Further correspondence has been useless. Later I find the complainer's own website has been offline since 16th March 2020. The website is entirely inaccessible. So I wonder how this could be called a valid "DMCA takedown notice"!Guess what? I find other funny things: 1) the complainer leaves no email address. 2) the name of the complainer is a famous German mathematician born in 19393) the number of the complainer is a suspicious number, flagged multiple times, given a simple googling4) the address the complainer leaves is a virtual business addressSo we are basically complained by an unknown, who shows their copyrighted works on a website that has been offline for more than a half year, who leaves no email address, whose name happens to be the same with a German mathematician, whose number has been flagged multiple times, and whose business address is virtual, and who starts the complaining letter with the familiar "To Whom It May Concern". The Director of Nexcess Support, along with another staff member from the Security Team, introduced as being very familiar with the DMCA requirements, thinks the DMCA takedown notice seems well formatted and is serious and valid!I hope all these are not coincidences. I hope Nexcess stuff members do would like to be helpful when issues occur, instead of debating. I hope Nexcess stuff members do check problems and facts. I hope Nexcess, as a company, does want to be supportive, instead of being slaved by their own policies. Unless my issue has been solved right away with compensation, or unless you don't care about fake DMCA notices that cause the banning of your website, you are not recommended to use Nexcess. I swear all the above facts are real.

I gave it 10 months on a one year plan and was continually getting "autoscale notification" messages.  I would check the web sites and not see anything that would indicate significant traffic at the time.  So I migrated back to the old server and changed the DNS to point there, yet even for the last 1.5 months when the DNS wasn't pointed to nexuses.net, I got some "autoscale usage notifications."  Given there wasn't any traffic going there, it doesn't seem possible it was accurate.  Likewise, the notifications would often say "We previously sent you a note to let you know that your site was experiencing additional visitors" which wasn't accurate - nothing in the spam folder either.Finally, they did tout auto-updating of plugins, but that rarely worked except when I set it up in WP myself.One caveat, the support people were always very nice and very helpful, but the servers they were using were seemingly underpowered and the tools they were using didn't seem accurate.  Hopefully they get the issues fixed and if so, I'd give it a try in a few years.Without those issues, I would've stayed there, but those were deal breakers for me.Thanksedit:As you can see from their reply, they are definitely on top of things and always have been pleasant and friendly.  They haven't ever answered why the autoscale notifications (a) claim one has already been sent when it hasn't, and (b) why autoscale is needed in the first place when there is limited traffic.  As above, I really hope they fix the issues I saw.  I had moved some sites from LiquidWeb CloudSites and some from AWS.  The performance on CloudSites had been better than nexcess seemed over the last 11 months subjectively, admittedly.  Nexcess did making moving there easy, so it probably wouldn't be difficult to move back at a later time.  For me, the main thing was the autoscale notifications on sites that weren't getting millions of visitors a day.  :-)

I'm Jojo's workmate and I have to talk with Nexcess over the recent DMCA takedown notice falsely and deliberately made towards us from competition. Later today I did some research and found something very interesting about the complainant's identity:1) the website, on which the complainant says their copyrighted images are listed has been offline since March 20202) the complainant leaves no email address; the letter has been submitted via web form3) the address, when searched on Google, shows VIRTUAL OFFICES AND BUSINESS ADDRESSES FOR RENT4) the phone number, when searched on Google, is flagged, and promoted as a prank phone: Frank will politely tell the person calling that you do not wish to be contacted by them. Because it's neutral in terms of location and message, you can use it in all sorts of situations, for example in official forms. You can preview Frank’s message here (a link); it’s German of course.The above, when combined, has to mean something. So we are basically attacked by an unknown, via Nexcess. Nexcess should at least have confirmed the existence of the complainant in the first place before taking action on our website. But Nexcess did not and they think it's the way to do it. Meanwhile Nexcess Support keeps telling me "the DMCA is complete and properly formatted, and as such we are processing it", three or four times. Nexcess Support is basically telling me they don't care about the identity of a DMCA complainer, whether it's fake or not, whether they can reach the complainer or not (anyway they won't even try to reach a complainer, at least in our case). As long as the DMCA takedown notice seems properly formatted and complete, they remove anything requested in it.I need Nexcess to tell me straight if it's too late, they are already processing it so we have to wait for 10 days this time. I need Nexcess to tell me if it's due to their negligence and if they could have done better by investigating the complainant's identity a little bit.

Review.Titre: Since we've been this far, I suggest we avoid standard business terms here.
Review.Contenu: I'm contacted by a member of the Support Leadership team at Nexcess, who lets me know the following: Per our procedures and to be aligned with DMCA compliance, we must act simply based on the correct formatting of the DMCA request itself which doesn't involve validating or investigating the complainant or submitter's identity. These are solely based on the formatting; there is no review or investigative work done on our end that we're required to validate the submitter.Strange enough that you care about only the formatting and would never go a little further to check some basics including the submitter's identity. It's the same to announce: everybody now please use Nexcess with a fake address, a fake name, and a fake email to SUCCESSFULLY attack your competitors hosted on Nexcess, as in my case; we don't question you as a submitter; we only target our clients. IS IT TRUE???And I'm thrown a page again about "What should I do if I get a DMCA Takedown notice" on DMCA official site, which says: ISP's / OSP's / Web Hosts do not have the right or responsibility to arbitrate the takedown process between parties or determine whether the takedown is valid or not. They most certainly can bring judgment as to whether the Takedown request or application is suitable, appropriate or meets the criteria set out on their website.Please note I'm not asking for arbitration this far. I'm questioning "whether the Takedown request or application is suitable, appropriate or meets the criteria set out on their website".Sure I find the following on Nexcess about their own "Copyright Infringement Policy".You request the following fields as necessary when a complainer is submitting a DMCA takedown notice:Your Full Legal Name*Your Contact Email Address*Your Contact Phone Number*Your Full Address:*The problem is: this complainer obviously didn't offer you an email address. If the email address is missing, how could you say it's complete and thus the DMCA is valid? Besides, if you don't even check the validity of these fields, then what's the point of wanting these fields as necessary in the first place?Let me say it again: the address they offered is virtual, the phone number is a prank phone number, the email is missing. SINCE YOU LIKE TO DIRECT ME TO THE OFFICIAL PAGE OF DMCA, please tell me if your vadality of the submitter is against "They most certainly can bring judgment as to whether the Takedown request or application is suitable, appropriate or meets the criteria set out on their website."You told me "Per our procedures and to be aligned with DMCA compliance, we must act simply based on the correct formatting of the DMCA request itself".You must simply act on the correct formatting ONLY???Anyway, do you really think "the takedown request or application is suitable, appropriate or meets the criteria set out on your own website", with no email address, a prank a phone number or a virtual address? Please explain. I don't wanna be suggested to get back to the private mode with any of your staff members. I want a crisp explanation here. A straight explanation. Three answers to three simple questions: 1) According to DMCA official, is it true "you must act on only the correct formatting and nothing else"? 2) Do you really think this DMCA takedown notice, with no email address, a prank a phone number or a virtual address, meets with the statement on official DMCA site that "bring judgment as to whether the Takedown request or application is suitable, appropriate or meets the criteria set out on their website?"3）Do you agree you have mishandled this case due to your own negligence? You answer me, one by one as to the three questions, do what you should do to fix it and this case is over. Normally clients will do what you tell them to do and you don't wanna deal with a serious client like us. The time you spend on us is NOT economical. Your clients or potential clients, however, do consider how you fix things and solve issues.

Review.Titre: Unhelpful and responsive to DMCA abuser
Review.Contenu: I'm a customer of Nexcess for over 5 years. Now I'm very confused, cringed, disappointed, and irritated by the way Nexcess treats their customer.Here's the story. Yesterday, my website was forbidden, as a result of a DMCA by a said copyright owner.Let's say what we do. We sell oil painting copies of artworks in public domain, artworks by Van Gogh, Monet and so forth. All the artists on our website have been dead for at least 70 years, so their artworks are in public domain, for anyone to use without permission. It's American law and there's no copyright owners of such artworks, for the copyrights have expired. And according to Title 17 "United States Code, as amended by this Act, does not provide copyright protection for any work that is in the public domain in the United States." It's common sense.The DMCA was apparently by competition, not the first time. Too bad, Nexcess failed to do some very basic homework, and arbitrarily forbade our website. So far, I've sent a dozen messages but were successfully ignored.Since anyone can submit a DMCA and DMCA abuses are not rare, see how easily your website may be attacked by your competition. We are running a major Adwords Campaign. Converting usually takes one week. See our loss.I want our service to be restored soonest possible! And Let's see the "infringing images" and how Nexcess was unhelpful and unsupportive, and lazy:Page: artists > pierre-puvis-de-chavannesPierre Puvis de Chavannes (14 December 1824 – 24 October 1898)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > arshile-gorkyArshile Gorky (April 15, 1904 - July 21, 1948)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > childe-hassamChilde Hassam (October 17, 1859 – August 27, 1935)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > robert-henriRobert Henri (24 June 1865 - 12 July 1929)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > ferdinand-hodlerFerdinand Hodler (14 March 1853 - 19 May 1918)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > nicholas-roerichNicholas Roerich (October 9, 1874 – December 13, 1947)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > john-frederick-kensettJohn Frederick Kensett (March 22, 1816 – December 14, 1872)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: collections > moise-kislingMoïse Kisling (January 22, 1891 – April 29, 1953)This is a collection page, rather than an artist page.All artworks listed under this page are not artworks by Moïse Kisling,but by artists who have been dead for over 70 years.Page: artists > albert-marquetAlbert Marquet (27 March 1875 – 14 June 1947)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > gustave-moreauGustave Moreau (6 April 1826 – 18 April 1898)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > berthe-morisotBerthe Marie Pauline Morisot (January 14, 1841 – March 2, 1895)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > jules-pascinJulius Mordecai Pincas (March 31, 1885 – June 5, 1930)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > walter-sickertWalter Richard Sickert (31 May 1860 – 22 January 1942)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > egon-schieleEgon Schiele (12 June 1890 – 31 October 1918)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > paul-signacPaul Victor Jules Signac (11 November 1863 – 15 August 1935)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > alfred-sisleyAlfred Sisley (30 October 1839 – 29 January 1899)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > chaim-soutineChaïm Soutine (13 January 1893 – 9 August 1943)Artist dead for over 70 yearsPage: artists > tom-thomsonThomas John Thomson (August 5, 1877 – July 8, 1917)Artist dead for over 70 yearsUpdated on 2020/10/11:Finally someone contacted me explaining the following: I apologize for the delay. While we do value you being a client, the content in question does need to be disabled as the DMCA is properly formatted and complete I'm afraid, and Liquid Web is also legally liable and required to ensure it's disabled.Please do use your legal team, instead of your customer service team! You are receiving many DMCA takedown notices and it's better to have a basic discernment. Not based on formatting!It's easy in our case to understand the term "public domain", and it's easy to check if these artworks truly belong to public domain. It takes you a few minutes. I mean it took you a few minutes to shut down our service right? Anyway, isn't public domain a very basic point a hosting company like you should know? It's such a difficult conception? Or you just won't do anything very foundemental to protect your clients from DMCA abuses? It's 2020 and It's ridiculous to claim they own the copyrights of all Egon Schiele works. Egon Schiele died in 1918! it's been over 100 years! And you believe in it and shut down our service? Restore our service as soon as possible. We're waiting.

Review.Titre: Hire more experienced personnel to support your customers
Review.Contenu: You need much more experienced system programmers to support your customer and wasting time.  i spent more 6 hours and several calls, listening to music, Nonsense responses. Until finally someone who new your system, could resolve a very simple issue.  Even one of your guys hanged up on me.Our time is as much valuable as your and we need fast response.

Review.Titre: I wrote my 1st ticket between 3 and 4…
Review.Contenu: I wrote my 1st ticket between 3 and 4 weeks ago but got nowhere. I couldn't login to update my website all this time. ( Ticket: 11684321) Last week I started all over again, got far better support and the issue was resolved. Nevertheless I couldn't upload any fresh content for a couple of weeks, which was very disappointing.

Review.Titre: Look elsewhere. Learn from my mistake.
Review.Contenu: I recently moved nearly 100 hosting clients to Nexcess and I deeply regret it. There are some things Nexcess does quite well: The migration plugin is excellent, for example. The interface is strong. But the uptime is TERRIBLE, to the point where my 2-star review is probably too generous. This week alone I've had two days of repeated outages. These are known outages that they cannot seem to fix.

Review.Titre: Not fit for sites with dynamic content
Review.Contenu: We chose their plan when we launched our WooCommerce website, and we went for a plan which, as they promised, is fit for 3500 orders per hour. The website speed lagged from day one, even with little traffic (server response time >2-3 sec) for dynamic pages, and once there were like 50 visitors online, we ran out of PHP workers, and the website went down.Their support was helpful and reachable 24/7, but what good of it if their server infrastructure is not made for sites with dynamic content?They even suggested jumping to a better plan (more expensive), but it did not help either.We learned that Nexcess might be a good price/performance fit for static pages where you can use page caching but for sites with much dynamic content - don't fall for their promises, as you will just lose time trying to resolve them.We resolved the issue by switching to another host and have had no issues since then.

Review.Titre: The support by ticket is ver slow
Review.Contenu: The support by ticket is ver slow, thake until 30 hours in give us a solution and not i am talking of big problems. Now always says that as is a futurehosting plan the they  will reach out to their team and some one will follow up with you as soon as possible. And that is hours. it is supposed that nexcess (liquidweb) bought this futurehosting company almost 3 years ago, so how come they should contact another team. The worst thing is that they take too long to respond and provide a solution.I just put a ticket (10:06 am East Time) for a problem that I can't make a backup of the public_html folder, I'll update as soon as it takes them to give me an answer to this simple request.Well, it's 12:32 am more than 2 hours and there is still no solution, they wrote to me saying that it is in the process of verification.The disagreement is that it is not only this time that there is a slow response, there have been many times, I have even had to resort to another type of support to solve it myself and I am not talking about complex problems, I am talking about simple problems, Said by those who have helped us on several occasions. When futurehosting was not part of Liquidweb, the support was excellent, they almost never took more than an hour to provide a solution, but with the change the service has gone from bad to worse. We have lost about 15 clients due to delays in solving simple failures. The contracted service is the full server managed with an extra charge for monitoring and support in third-party scripts; So it was contracted with futurehosting and when changing they never informed us of any change in the services

Using Nexcess for hosting of our Magento web sites. We've had numerous technical issues none of which we caused or could solve. This has resulted in significant downtime. We never really get an answer of what the root cause was. The issues do get solved in time but I have fairly low confidence that we won't experience more issues in the future.

Based upon previous experiences with Trustpilot and Liquid Web, I believe you're able to track these comments back to me.Therefore I refer you to my many open tickets, which I've had to create way too often.  And the "Feedback" page, where many others before me have made suggestions that shouldn't be considered "feature requests" but instead should have been part of this system from day one, which are still sitting on the list.  How many upvotes does it take to make some common-sense improvements?  At least I know I'm not the only one who is experiencing major frustration, and losing valuable time, using your portal.

Review.Titre: The platform is good, support is terrible
Review.Contenu: The platform is good, and has more options than its counterpart LiquidWeb. However their support is TERRIBLE, on multiple occasions and with multiple agents. I really hope they merge their support team with LiquidWeb's as quickly as possible. I miss them already and I'm not even fully migrated over.

Review.Titre: Customer support has not been great
Review.Contenu: Customer support has not been great, and basic functionality like removing a credit card (after you've added a new one) doesn't work. Sites might be fast, but we've had much better luck with customer support with hosting companies just as fast.
Extremely poor Customer Support. Takes hours to get back a reply. Not a fan. I think I should switch my hosting provider now.
Continual downtime, poor customer service, not reliable. Complained many times and finally had enough! I'd go somewhere else.

Review.Titre: First support experience not so great
Review.Contenu: This was my first support interaction with Nexcess after being required to migrate over from Liquid Web Managed Wordpress. One of my sites went down so I used support chat. It took several minutes just to get someone to verify that the site was down. Then they asked me if I had done something to cause the outage. This was a clue that the person might not know what they are doing, because my previous experience with Liquid Web hosting was that support reps usually know more about the situation faster than I can type in a chat. It took approx 30 minutes for the rep to create a trouble ticket. I was treated as if I was an employee who should know how everything works. I was not given courtesy guidance or instruction on next steps. I had to ask what to do. I did not receive a courtesy apology like “sorry for the inconvenience.” Basically poor bedside manner. Once the site was back up, I asked why it had gone down and they said they did not know but a reboot of the server fixed it. Great. So why not just give me a button to reboot it myself? I am left having learned nothing and feeling less secure about my site’s uptime. Next time this happens I will start shopping for a new managed Wordpress provider. What happened to the kind Liquid Web support team I grew dependent on over the past 14 years? I hope this was a one-off!

Review.Titre: First of all it took 24 hours to get…
Review.Contenu: First of all it took 24 hours to get the issue resolved. That was too long a time to resolve an issue on a live site. That is the only issue. I think 4 or 5 different people worked on the issue and then it got resolved. I believe support technicians need more training to resolve the issue quickly.

The company can improve on quick response to customer’s concerns. I could not checkout my order and I contacted the customer service and it took at least 1 week before my concern was completely resolved. The good thing was that the last handler of my case resolved it within one hour. This means that there was capacity for the team to have resolved the issue promptly when it was initially raised. Weldone team.

For many years hosting server with them for my agency. Price was increased during the years but consumer service now send you to blogs instead having a person helping with simple tasks. Can be better.

Review.Titre: the answers from the support team take…
Review.Contenu: the answers from the support team take a long time, it has even been necessary to open a chata to ask for an answer to an open ticket.And in many cases the answers from support are very ambiguous, where they are not consistent with what is required, it seems that they do not read carefully the requirements of the ticket and they repsonden on the run.In Ticket #: 12273325, we asked for help because google does not validate a cname record created and they just said that there was a report of risky sites made by google and not by nexcess, which is completely of our knowledge, but the help from their part was never produced.really leaves much to be desired from nexcess-liquidweb support.

Review.Titre: The ticketing system is very slow
Review.Contenu: The ticketing system is very slow.  Getting answers to questions while trying to migrate sites is wasting entire days waiting.  Also the responses are difficult to understand sometimes as the grammar in the responses can be difficult to parse.

UPDATE: I was able to get issue fixed, but it took time and effort from my side.. and maybe a review on Trustpilot to make things move. It would have took 12 days to get an appropriate answer and then they provided an adequate solution in a matter of hours and I am happy with it.I do believe Nexcess would make world better by providing more detailed information during pre-sale and purchase to avoid confusion and errors. I do not think it's fair to sell an option at $x and charge it again at $y if disabled/enabled, by mistake or not.I think, fundamentally, Nexcess is a good solution provider, but the Sales team seems to be more oriented to get new customers quickly than to take time to sell what is best for the customer.My feelings toward Nexcess are playing yo-yo. But I can now give 3 stars instead of 1.-----ORIGINAL: Price information on website wrong when buying. Hidden fees. Lack of training and knowledge for many techs. Basically, the Sales team is doing a great job, but don't expect help if something goes wrong.Long delays to get answers and depending with whom you will talk or chat, the answer might differ.Cannot TRUST the information they provide.

Review.Titre: Support has gone WAY downhill lately
Review.Contenu: UPDATE from 1 to 3 star review:Support did come through and fix our issue after escallating (Dutch was great), and offered a resolve for future issues. For that I'm bumping up my rating from 1 star to 3 - very much appreciate that. The issues I still have are that they point the finger at the platform (ExpressionEngine) although they offer/sell ExpressionEngine hosting, and are supposed to be an offical "partner" - therefore there shouldn't be any "special needs" for EE over WordPress or Magento environments, and staff should be equally knowledeable on all platforms they tote to support. There are also still the issues that: most of their staff does't seem to be aware that there are special needs for EE environments, and that they have outdated/misleading documentation on their website (which they will point you to/misguide you to, via ticket or chat). So, while we're satisfied for now to have a resolve/work-around for when we do run into issues due to these "special" needs - it still isn't quite (or not yet) the same awesome hosting & support for EE that it used to be. For being a "partner" hosting company for ExpressionEngine, it should be fully/equally supported, online documentation should be current (or at least noted if outdated). At the least, support staff should all be aware of these "special needs" for EE and if/when documentation is outdated so they're not misguiding customers.Previous 1 star review:Used to absolutely LOVE nexcess and has been our preferred hosting and who we recommend to all of our clients. But as of lately, support is completely worthelss, and they've even broken a LIVE site of ours and left it that way for HOURS before it came to our attention. They used old code from your outdated docs that I had already explained broke the site, but they put it back and did not test and just left it that way - that is absolutely NOT OK! We should never have to worry about that. All support experiences lately have been pretty bad and therefore we are starting to look elsewhere, we can no longer recommend your product or services to our clients.

Review.Titre: Fixed what they broke, I guess.
Review.Contenu: The support was good in that they fixed my problem, but I can't give more than 3 stars because the problem shouldn't have happened in the first place. My site was down during one of the busiest traffic times of the week because of their error and it took an hour to get the site back up. They didn't have a server failover or mirror or anything. Waiting on hold on the phone and on the chat for 8-10 minutes is a long time when your site is serving up a 500 error.

My experience wasn't bad. However, I did lose a lot of traffic to my website because of the DNS issue. They say it has been resolved now. I changed my DNS extension to the Cloudflare extensions to secure my site. I now need to wait another 24 hours, which is becoming a problem.

Review.Titre: They never give up until you're satisfied.
Review.Contenu: It took a while, and a few emails back and forth, but in the end all my problems were taken care of. To be honest, part of the problem was that I was over my head to start, but the support team walked me through and asked the right questions. In the end I was satisfied.

Great host for Magento, but the pricing page lacks transparency.I expected to have a test environment and an elasticsearch container supplied with the plan I chose but that was not the case.I had to rent another server.The migration process was smooth.

Great Wordpress hosting packages. Support is awesome. Migration to Nexcess is easy. Availability of great plugins specially for security. Only little issue is that there are unexpected downtimes at times. This could be due to any reasons like DDOS attacks or failure of infrastructure or failure of network. Apart from this Nexcess is great. Fully recommended.

Pretty darned good. The website and email hosting parts of the service are excellent. Their admin portal works smoothly and logically.Bummer part: their domain name registration system. They require a separate login for updating nameservers - which doesn't go to account delegates. You can't just update nameservers in the Nexcess portal like you'd expect. It's lame. But this said, how many people actually update their nameservers? For those of us who do, all it requires is getting on with support via chat or phone and they'll handle it for me. Other than that they offer a LOT of value and a decent price. (I just wish they didn't charge for the WAF server - but $5/mo isn't the end of the world)

Rated 4/5, the reason is object-cache-pro always overwrites when we migrate our sites. You need to chat for support for them to re-install back and licensed it. If we could move that feature to Nexcess dashboard, it would reduce the conflict in migration and easy for us to enable/disable.  Overall infrastructure is competitive as well as the pricing vs WPengine.

Review.Titre: Great tech support when migrating website
Review.Contenu: Nexcess did a site migration for our company, and there were a lot of unforeseen problems with emails and going over our disk quota. I feel like these problems should have been automatically taken care of by the migration team. I had to contact Nexcess' support a few times by phone and online, and when I did they were great at fixing the problems and getting me answers. I just wish it hadn't been necessary to contact them for support in the first place.
The domain registration didn't go through but Support was instantly there from your side. Thank you for solving the issue so fast.

Review.Titre: Moved to nexcess from one of the…
Review.Contenu: Moved to nexcess from one of the largest hosting service.I use woocommerce and my last hosting service was so slow and expensive that I can't stand. Woo was very slow already, how slow? It always takes 30 sec to load a product edit page in back-end...and sometimes 20 sec to load a product page in incognito mode for customers, small store so I only had at most 20 visitors at the same timeWas paying 40usd a month for it now nexcess is crazy fast, everythings great, takes maybe 10 seconds to load edit page and doesn't make it slow for ppl to use the site in China(while my previous hosting service does, mostly Chinese visitors can't even load the site), a single product page takes 2 sec to load now, quite impressiveBut its really recommended that you at least have to hv 1 developer if you're a noob and you're doing e-commerce (I made my website all by myself from YouTube and hired a developer only very recently) because their customer service needs time, sometimes it might need a whole day to solve a simple problem , but I rather use the money I saved for hirin a developer because it's much faster and simpler.By the way I'm using the starter plan for USD$13 and the migration was free, quite a steal actually only for the performance, but again you really really really have to have your own developer.Although I think the support staffs are quite nice and mostly solve your problems in 1hr, esp Max, he really gets problems solved quickly, and nice

I have an ongoing error issue (it doesn't affect my site) that makes me weary and support can't seem to find a fix so the ticket remains open, that's the only reason I don't give Nexcess 5 stars, other than that I really think Nexcess is excellent.
Always quick to respond! And helpful. Some downtime issues but most of the time is super!

Review.Titre: It was very good and easy to use

Review.Contenu: Provided repeated replies and follow-up during the days involved to sort out multiple problems dealing with a new website, new hosting and domain difficulties, Job well done, especially Sathya.

Review.Titre: I reached out with issues/questions and…
Review.Contenu: I reached out with issues/questions and you responded with answers!

I have used Nexcess for several years now, ever since I inherited the website I currently run. Nexcess has always been very knowledgeable and help when I've run into issues that I really haven't a clue what to do with (as I said above I inherited the site, so I basically just maintain it for other's use and pray it runs well) - and Nexcess makes that happen.

I have been a customer of Nexcess since 2015 and typically have such great service. I was having trouble with my I themes and it took three weeks to get it straight. It was a word press issue and just took the time to reach the right tech support to get help. Rest assured this is not typical of the service rendered by Nexcess.

Review.Titre: Early Review–but really happy with Support and Hosting Plan
Review.Contenu: So far we are completely pleased with our hosting plan, more specifically, the technical support we've received. The support team has responded rapidly and each ticket that was opened was resolved within hours. (Probably sooner had we responded more rapidly ourselves).All in all, totally excited to have found a good hosting company and hope that things continue to run so smoothly.

Review.Titre: Had an issue when updating the PHP…
Review.Contenu: Had an issue when updating the PHP version of my site and afterward when I tried to load a backup the Nexcess portal crashed. Customer support was helpful, although it took a bit more time than expected to revert to an older backup and bring back the old PHP version.

Nexcess was our developer's recommendation. It's kind of nerdy I suppose. I am not a huge fan of the user interface, which is poorly laid out. It's hard to find the functions you need. But support more than makes up for that and always leaves me feeling good about Nexcess.

Review.Titre: it is in order for the first experience with nexcess
Review.Contenu: support is occasionally faster than expected

I love Nexcess. Support is fantastic, and security is truly top notch. I love that account setup is still a manual thing, and that sites are vetted to make sure they're a good fit. What keeps my review from being a full 5 stars is the storage limits on the EEP 100 plan. 10 GB is not much space for web and email. We used to use EngineHosting, which used Rackspace to handle emails. Just a thought. Still, I'd recommend and have recommended Nexcess to many people. Y'all keep up the stellar work!

Their management always steps in immediately to resolve any negative feedback.4. They don't have cPanel so it was a learning curve, but now I love their dashboard. And ftp credentials are easily accessible.5. Backups, restores and staging sites are so simple to manage.5. Having a built-in CDN is so convenient.6. Free Astra Pro plus other special offers included.7. And super fast!Thank you so much!

Review.Titre: I was extremely surprised how fast they respond
Review.Contenu: I was extremely surprised how fast they responded to my small request via email (as in 30 to 40 minutes or less). That's extremely important especially if your site is down and your losing thousands per hour.  In my case, my site was initially down and then my email after they setup my site.   Monetary wise, it didn't affect me since I'm in the initial stages of setting up my business but once I get to the selling stage, I can count on there email support.  I do recall using the chat/phone support last year when deciding who I should use as my host and they answered right away and were extremely informative.   I suppose I would get faster service via chat/phone.  Either way, whether email, phone, or chat, they are extremely prompt in getting you the help you need.

So, the person who read the initial ticket closed it without examining the ticket.This has happened before...so, we have to check to make sure Nexcess actually helped us or ignored us.But, when I called Zac was very helpful and apologetic for the situation and created out of office reply immediately...Great work by Zac and poor work by Management at Nexcess in communicating to their Help Desk that some accounts cannot create their own out of office replies...Why we can't is another issue altogether.

Review.Titre: A Standout Solution for Magento 2: My Experience with Nexcess
Review.Contenu: As the owner of an online store built on Magento 2, finding the right web hosting has been crucial to the success of my business. After researching and testing various options, I can confidently say that Nexcess is the perfect choice for any online store owner using Magento 2.What sets Nexcess apart is their specialized focus on hosting e-commerce platforms. The performance of my store has been nothing short of exceptional. Pages load swiftly, and response times are snappy, significantly enhancing my customers' shopping experience.Nexcess's scalability has been a lifesaver for my growing business. As my store has gained popularity, I've been able to seamlessly upgrade my hosting plan. This flexibility gives me the confidence that Nexcess will grow alongside my business.Security is a top priority for me, and Nexcess does not disappoint in this regard. Their advanced security measures, including firewalls and constant monitoring, provide me with peace of mind knowing that my store is shielded against cyber threats.Nexcess's technical support deserves a special mention. Their team is highly competent and always ready to assist with any hosting-related issues or queries. Knowing that I have a reliable team at my disposal is invaluable.In summary, my experience with Nexcess has been extraordinary. If you're an online store owner using Magento 2, I cannot recommend Nexcess enough. Their specialized approach, outstanding performance, and exceptional customer care make it the obvious choice. Thanks to Nexcess, my store has reached new levels of success, and I'm excited for what the future holds.
